Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <AkiraX> How do you short bitcoin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://www.bitmex.com and similar

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I wouldn't advise doing it, if you never have done it before.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> BitMex is another beast altogether

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> 1 Billion dollars in daily volume

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Agreed, it's like a casino but the rules are against you 100X worse

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> At least in a casino the house must pay out usually 95%+ according to law

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Bitmex just makes people poor all day

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Also, you can get mega-rich if you are smart+lucky. Hence all the users

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> BitMex has an in house trading department

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I forget the guys name, he's not that old.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> But BitMex has a huge affect on the actual Bitcoin price

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Because although it's a derivative, it requires BTC to get XBT

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> And they stop hunt

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Both up and down

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> They know, a lot of BTC entered at $8100.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> If you short, 50x at $8100, it'll be about an $8280 or $8300 liquidiation

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> So naturally, guys will set a stop loss at $8220, or somewhere even lower than that.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> They will maybe move if down $40 quick, and then back up $90.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> You must have good TA.
If not and you're on BitMex, just get Arthur's personal BTC address and just send it to him ahead of time.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> This is my system
I.   Draw trend lines.
II.  Locate Support/Resistance
III. Identity target to give confirmation.
IV. Identity entry, exit and stop loss.
V. Make trade, with confirmation.
VI. Exit exchange and find something else to do.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Privatoshi i would say it gives a tiny amount of privacy, but since AtomicDEX uses transparent addresses, even if you have a Tor IP, the addresses you use can uniquely identify you, later on.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> similar to using Tor with BTC. It can give you some privacy, but only at the IP address level, not at the address level.
